channel.title: Do not bot
channel.description:
Hopefully you read this thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,521532.0.html
Basically I knew Jagex would have already implemented part of there system without an announcement. So on one of my botted pures, I botted for 24 hours (months ago I could go for 3-4 days straight), it was banned after 24 hours for macroing, and the account hadn't been touched in months.
Therefore, do not bot, you will get banned almost instantly.

Ya right.
I’ll believe it when Bin Laden is killed.

No way? How did you ever find that out.

mod chrisso would never say that. Jagex mods would never promote botting, they hate it.

Plus, hello, the last comment in the pic, you can’t have that as a profile pic, its nothing or an rs character.[/quote]

item.title: Do not bot
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:80, topic:419265”][quote author=judostar1 link=topic=521787.msg3794199#msg3794199 date=1319505027]

Well, we can still auto-click alchemy for mage?

Maybe…

technically auto-clicking is just a 3rd party program, it’s not like botting, auto clickers are like you clicking super fast, auto typers are like talking extremely fast.

The only thing i really hate is an auto clicker at a drop party and an auto typer adverting gold farming sites.

Uhm, how is a computer program doing something automatically for you not botting? If you intended to mean it from Jagex’s perspective, well I’m positive even those programs are detectable. In many ways, the most detectable. Fast autotypers get banned for typing unhumanistically fast and consistently. All autotypers can get banned for sending the same message over again without errors over long periods of time. Autoclickers can get banned for performing the EXACT same mouse procedure over and over again for long periods of time.

In retrospect, those simple programs which will still work after this nuke, are the most obvious and most easily detectable. No, what I’m more concerned about is their means of detecting color bots.

lol I’ve been using auto clicker on one of my rs accs, i set it to 1-2 seconds cause alching hurts my figures after awhile.

[/quote]

I was simply enlightening you on the logistics of it. No clue if Jagex is making a move on these lesser used applications, but it would be foolish of me to expect they wouldn’t. If they are spending so many resources focusing on far more complex means of detecting bots, surely those systems would easily cover these completely blatant automatons.[/quote]

yeah, considering if you use an auto clicker for about 1-3 seconds like every normal player would click, then it kinda goes undetected, but have it at like .10millasecs. then you got a problem.

I highly doubt jagex is going after lesser applications like auto clickers and auto typers because as far as I’ve seen, their main concern is on bots and especially on bots adverting real-world trading sites.

Read full topic
